com.zorben.dns.util

Class CSParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zorben.dns.util.CSParser

  • public class CSParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class with utility functions for parsing and writing DNS encoded character strings.
    Author:
    Mac Crompton
    See Also:
    RFC 1035 Section 3.3 - Standard RRs

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CSParser()

      static int parseCharString(byte[] data, int start, java.lang.StringBuilder sb)
      Parses a DNS encoded character string, into a Java string.
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte> toByteArray(java.lang.String string)
      Returns a byte ArrayList that contains the character string in DNS Protocol character string format.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CSParser

        public CSParser()

    • Method Detail

      • parseCharString

        public static int parseCharString(byte[] data,
                                  int start,
                                  java.lang.StringBuilder sb)
        Parses a DNS encoded character string, into a Java string. Places the result into sb.
        Parameters:
        data - - The raw data from the dns message
        start - - The starting index of the character string
        sb - - The StringBuilder to place the resultant string into.
        Returns:
        - The index immediately after the 0 for the specified character string.
        See Also:
        RFC 1035 Section 3.3 - Standard RRs

      • toByteArray

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Byte> toByteArray(java.lang.String string)
        Returns a byte ArrayList that contains the character string in DNS Protocol character string format.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to be converted
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of bytes containing the formatted character string.
